boardgame.name: Field Commander: Napoleon
boardgame.description: Welcome to Field Commander: Napoleon, the third in our series of Field Commander games. The goal in designing this game system was to make the careers of some of history_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s great commanders accessible in an easy to learn, fast playing game format. We decided on solitaire, because it had the proper feel. Commanders have staff and advisors, but in the end, they alone make the hard decisions that affect lives, change the course of campaigns, and decide the fate of nations._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In this game, you make all the decisions needed to command your Forces. The game rules, charts, and die rolls dictate the actions of the opposing forces._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Dan Verssen Games (DV1 010) Field Commander Napoleon is our biggest game to date, as befits the Empire, the Emperor, and his Grande Armée! The game is so massive it requires a 4_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; high box! Wan Chiu created the artwork for this mega game. He got off to a fantastic start with a classic box cover design. The game design focuses on the battlefield tactics and Napoleon’s powerful personality. Through political and military cunning, Napoleon swept France to super-power status. In previous Field Commander games, supply was a primary concern. As the Emperor himself said, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;An army travels on its stomach._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; In this game, Napoleon’s achievements and public adulation drive all facets of game play. Be successful, gain the support of your troops and your countrymen, and you can achieve anything! The game spans all of Napoleon’s campaigns from Italy in 1796 to Waterloo in 1815. Success depends on the vital balance between strategic and tactical focus. You must move your forces across the maps to achieve your strategic goals, but you must also out-think your opponents on the battlefield.

Description: Field Commander Napoleon is DVG Games_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; biggest game to date, as befits the Empire, the Emperor, and his Grande Armée! The game is so massive it requires a 4_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; high box! The game is designed to focus on Napoleon_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s brilliant battlefield tactics and powerful personality. In previous Field Commander games, supply was a primary concern. As the Emperor himself said, “An army travels on its stomach.” In this game, Napoleon’s achievements and public acclaim drive all aspects of game play. Be successful, gain the support of your troops and your countrymen, and you can achieve anything! Success depends on the vital balance between strategic and tactical focus. You must move your forces across the maps to achieve your strategic goals, but you must also out-think your opponents on the battlefield. You can play each campaign as a stand-alone game, or as part of a linked series of games. The 11 Campaigns include: First Coalition 1796 Egypt 1798 Second Coalition 1800 Third Coalition 1805 Fourth Coalition 1806 Spain 1807 Fifth Coalition 1809 Russia 1812 Confederation of the Rhine 1813 France Invaded 1814 100 Days 1815 In this unique game format, you alone command the French forces and make the hard decisions that affect lives, change the course of Campaigns, and decide the fate of nations. The game rules, charts, and die rolls dictate the actions of the opposing forces. You take on the role of Napoleon and command the French Forces and their allies in each campaign. When you return, covered in glory and riches, it is YOU the citizens of France will be cheering! Contents: 7 Large Full Color Wibalin-Wrapped Mounted Map Boards (11” x 17”) 6 Full Color Counter sheets 1 Full Color Battle Map Board (8.5” x 11”) 1 Full Color Player Log Sheet Rulebook ********************************** Our Philosophy: We are not satisfied unless you are satisfied! It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s that simple. In business for over 5 years, we understand the most critical aspects of ecommerce. Deliver good value, keep you posted on that status of your order and be available for help should the need arise. Description: All games are new and still in factory shrink-wrap. How to place an Order? Via the BoardGameGeek “shopping cart” Note: If this is your first purchase on BoardGameGeek, Go to http://boardgamegeek.com/wiki/page/Marketplace_Buyer_Guide for more information. Payment: Payment via PayPal “Griffin@GriffinsToyChest.com” (PayPal Verified) Shipping: Griffin’s Toy Chest ships via USPS (2-3 day service) or Fed-Ex Ground (2-5 business days) to anywhere within the United States. You will receive a price quote for each shipping option and you choose which of these two shipping option best fits your needs. All shipments are made within 2-3 days of receiving your cleared PayPal payment. Note: feel free to combine items to reduce shipping cost. Returns: Our return policy mirrors our philosophy; we are not satisfied unless you are satisfied! You may return any unopened item within 30 days of delivery for a full refund of the purchase price less shipping costs. Simply contact us to make return arrangements. Note: if an item is damaged in transit, an item exchange will be made at no additional cost to the buyer. Note that we take special pains to package all of your items properly but in the event of the unforeseen, we have you covered!
Contact: Please contact us via email: Griffin@GriffinsToyChest.com: phone (M-F 9 AM -6PM EST) 1-888-228-3716; or mail: Griffins Toy Chest, P.O. Box 13731, Fairlawn, OH 44313

This is due to the box being too small to hold the punched counters. I have mended all but one corner which needs to remain loose other wise the top part of the box is almost impossible to remove. Der Karton des Spieles (Deckel und Box) ist an einer Ecke gerissen (War bereits seit Erstversand vom Hersteller so, lag in erster Linie daran, dass die vergleichsweise dünne Schachtel vollgepackt war mit vielen Spielbrettern und Countern. Die geklippten Counter sind per hand und nicht 100 % gleichmäßig geklippt, ich habe dafür keine Maschine oder ähnliches benutzt. Wenn so etwas für dich ein Problem ist, dann bitte nicht ersteigern! Ich lege noch zwei große Sortierkästen bei, in denen die Counter aufbewahrt werden können. Die Steine sind alle bereits nach den jeweiligen Szenarien zusammensortiert!
